contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox settlement |name = Homiel Voblast |other_name = Gomel Oblast |native_name = {{lang|be|Го́мельская во́бласць}} {{lang|ru|Го́мельская о́бласть}} |native_name_lang = |image_flag = Flag of Homyel Voblast.svg |flag_link = Flag of Homiel Voblast |image_shield = Coat of arms of Homyel Voblast.svg |shield_size = |shield_link = Coat of arms of Homiel Voblast |flag_size = |image_skyline = |imagesize = |image_caption = |image_map = Homiel Voblast in Belarus.svg |mapsize = |settlement_type = |subdivision_type = |subdivision_name = |subdivision_type1 = [[Capital (political)|Administrative center]] |subdivision_name1 = [[Gomel]] |subdivision_type2 = [[List of cities in Belarus|Largest cities]] |subdivision_name2 = [[Gomel]] - 481,200<br> [[Mazyr]] - 111,800<br> [[Zhlobin]] - 72,800 |subdivision_type3 = [[Raion]]s |subdivision_name3 = 21<br> Cities - 17<br> Urban localities - 278<br> Villages - 2,608 |subdivision_type4 = City raions |subdivision_name4 = 4 |subdivision_type5 = |subdivision_name5 = |latd= |latm= |lats= |latNS= |longd= |longm= |longs= |longEW= |area_total_km2 = 40400 |population_total =1,495,100 |population_as_of = |population_density_km2 =37 |elevation_max_m = |elevation_min_m = |elevation_footnotes = |image_dot_map = |dot_x = |dot_y = |postal_code_type = |postal_code = |area_code = |leader_title = Chairman |leader_name = [[Alexander Yakobson]] |website = [http://www.gomel-region.by www.gomel-region.by] }} '''Homiel Voblast''' or '''Gomel Oblast''' ({{lang-be|Го́мельская во́бласць}}; [[Romanization of Belarusian|translit.:]] ''Homel'skaya Voblasts''; {{lang-ru|Го́мельская о́бласть}}; [[Romanization of Belarusian|translit.:]] ''Gomel'skaya Oblast'') is a [[province]] ([[voblast]]) of [[Belarus]] with its [[Capital city|administrative center]] being [[Homyel]]. Important cities within the voblasts include: [[Gomel]], [[Mazyr]], [[Zhlobin]], [[Svetlahorsk]], [[Rečyca|Rechytsia]], [[Kalinkavichy]], [[Rahachow]], [[Dobruš|Dobrush]] Homiel Province and [[Mahilyow Voblast]] suffered severely after the [[Chernobyl]] [[nuclear reactor]] [[Chernobyl disaster|catastrophe]].<ref>http://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Chernobyl_radiation_map_1996.svg</ref> The Gomel Province borders the [[Chernobyl Exclusion Zone]] in places, and part of it is designated as mandatory or voluntary resettlement areas as a result of the [[radioactive contamination]].<ref>{{Cite book | publisher = CRC Press | isbn = 9780750306706 | last = Mould | first = Richard Francis | title = Chernobyl Record: The Definitive History of the Chernobyl Catastrophe | date = 2000-05-01 }}</ref> ==Administrative Subdivisions== The Homiel Voblasts comprises 21 [[districts]] ([[raions]]), 278 [[selsovets]], 17 cities, and 8 city municipalities. ===Cities and towns=== * [[Gomel]] ({{lang-be|Го́мель}}; {{lang-ru|Гомель}}) - 481,200 * [[Mazyr]] ({{lang-be|Мазы́р}}; {{lang-ru|Мо́зырь}}) - 111,800 * [[Zhlobin]] ({{lang-be|Жло́бін}}; {{lang-ru|Жло́бин}}; [[Belarusian Latin alphabet|Łacinka]]: Žłobin)- 72,800 * [[Svetlahorsk]] ({{lang-be|Светлаго́рск}}; {{lang-ru|[[File:Ltspkr.png]] [[Media:RU-Svetlogorsk.ogg|Светлого́рск]]}})- 71,700 * [[Rechytsa]] ({{lang-be|Рэчыца}}, {{lang-ru|Речица}}) - 66,200 * [[Kalinkavichy]] ({{lang-be|Калінкавічы}}) - 37,900 * [[Rahachow]] ({{lang-be|Рагачоў}}; {{lang-ru|Рогачёв}}) - 34,700 * [[Dobrush]] - 19,300 * [[Zhytkavichy]]({{lang-be|Жыткавічы}}) - 16,900 * [[Khoiniki]] ({{lang-be|Хойнікі}}; {{lang-ru|Хойники}}) - 14,200 * [[Pyetrykaw]] ({{lang-be|Петрыкаў}}; {{lang-ru|Петриков}}) - 10,600 * [[Yelsk]] ({{lang-be|Ельск}}; {{lang-ru|Ельск}}) - 10,000 * [[Buda-Kashalyowa]] ({{lang-be|Буда-Кашалёва}}; {{lang-ru|Буда-Кошелёво}}) - 9,500 * [[Narowla]] ({{lang-be|Нароўля}}; {{lang-ru|Наровля}}) - 8.200 * [[Vetka]] ({{lang-be|Ветка}}; {{lang-ru|Ветка}}) - 7,800 * [[Chachersk]] ({{lang-be|Чачэрск}}; {{lang-ru|Чечерск}}) - 7,700 * [[Vassilyevichy]] - 4,500 * [[Turaw]] ({{lang-be|Ту́раў}}; {{lang-ru|Ту́ров}}) - 3,200 * [[Brahin (town)|Brahin]] - 3,700 ==Geography of Homiel Voblast== [[File:Svetlahorsk Berezina river BY.jpg|thumb|225px|right|The frozen Svetlahorsk Berezina river.]] ==See also== *[[Subdivisions of Belarus]] *[[Gomel Province]] (disambiguation) ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.gomel-region.gov.by/index.php?lang=txt_eng Homyel Regional Executive Committee] {{Homyel Voblast}} {{First-level administrative divisions of Belarus}} {{coord missing|Belarus}} <!--Categories--> [[Category:Gomel Region| ]] [[Category:Regions of Belarus]]
